snippet: An internal White House document that compiling steps to be taken on changes to National Security Agency practices, including recommendations by a review group President Obama appointed. It shows the administration recognized that the review...
lead_paragraph: An internal White House document that compiling steps to be taken on changes to National Security Agency practices, including recommendations by a review group President Obama appointed. It shows the administration recognized that the review group’s would mean making “significant changes” to the use of American communications gathered without a warrant by the N.S.A. under Executive Order 12333.

headline.main: Recommendation Not Taken Meant ‘Significant Changes’ for Executive Order 12333 Intercepts

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
